firstVisitBanner.title: Welcome - Portfolio under construction
firstVisitBanner.body: This website-portfolio is still under construction. Development takes place in the evenings after my main job or on weekends, so some sections may be incomplete or subject to change

hero.role: Currently seeking a junior front-end role to consolidate production experience

repo.textBeforeLink: To explore the GitHub repository for this site, follow this
repo.privacy: This site is intentionally not indexed for privacy.

intro.paragraph1: Hi, my name is Francesco and I have been working in IT for over 5 years, in different roles and on a variety of activities, from technical work to personal projects.
intro.paragraph2: This site collects experiments, studies, and work related to web development, used as a space for growth, documentation, and to provide an example of my practical skills in the web field.
intro.morePrefix: If you want more context about my journey and availability, you can find everything in the

dev.titlePrefix: Stack and how I am applying it here; learn more in

nuxt.title: Nuxt
nuxt.description: Intuitive project structure and smooth navigation without page reloads: it makes development simpler, cleaner, and more natural even on complex projects.

tailwind.title: Tailwind
tailwind.description: Lean, fast, and consistent styling system: it uses readable classes and keeps the styling workflow uniform across the team.

i18n.title: i18n
i18n.description: Centralized language management: text organized in one place and easy language switching on main pages.

emailjs.title: EmailJS vs n8n
emailjs.description: n8n is more powerful and flexible but requires managing its structure, while EmailJS is free and can be integrated directly via JavaScript with your email.

netlify.title: Netlify
netlify.description: Simple site publishing: GitHub connection, automatic deploys on every update, and free hosting for frontend projects.

codex.title: Codex
codex.description: Development assistant that, when used with code oversight, speeds up programming by supporting scaffolding, refactoring, and project organization.

clickup.title: ClickUp
clickup.description: Core tool for managing work activities: I collect and organize tasks and share updates with collaborators, keeping priorities, status, and deadlines under control.

figma.title: Figma
figma.description: Operational reference for layout measurements and received designs, extracting component specs and, when needed, creating site schemas, wireframes, or basic layouts to define page structure.

carousel.subtitle: I LIKE MOSS AND GECKOS
carousel.title: Some Best Forests
carousel.shiftHint: Press "shift" and use the mouse wheel to scroll horizontally!

fallback.title: Welcome to the fallback page
fallback.body: The content you are looking for does not exist, you probably clicked a sample link from the menu.
fallback.counter: This fallback has appeared {count} times on this browser.
fallback.btsCaption: "Me" working on this project during the weekends

summary.title: Brief summary
summary.p1: Always passionate about video games, I approached the computer as a hobby, until COVID, when I took a frontend programming course and changed career from my previous experiences.
summary.p2: I had the pleasure of building websites and stepping into the fascinating world of programming, both as a frontend developer and, over time, as a project manager for some independent startups.
summary.p3: Unfortunately, the current socioeconomic climate led to the end of that PM experience, especially with the arrival of an offer for a help-desk role in the IT offices at the Esselunga headquarters, a role I currently cover.
summary.p4: My goal is to find a company where I can see my skills grow, in a world where technology grows exponentially, and to become more and more able to leverage that growth to create features, products, and content, while also maintaining a constructive work-life balance.

availability.title: Availability
availability.p1: Like everyone, I have some clear preferences, but I remain open and flexible to evaluate any proposal.
availability.summaryTitle: In summary, I am available for:

list.travel: Very open to relocations and business trips

availability.p2: I remain open to all the options listed above, considering that I perform at my best, especially in terms of productivity and quality, in a full-remote role between 30 and 32 hours, partly synchronous and/or team-based and partly asynchronous through task completion.
availability.p3: I am also aware that the first periods of work may be fully on-site in order to evaluate the resources I bring.

items.vat: I have an Italian VAT number
